intro: Hydrolea glabra f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered hydrolea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
